TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/Header/Item extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of an item of the header control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.Header.Item class gets a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of a header item.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Header.Item.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementHeaderItem1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#166](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_108_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#166](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_108_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a hot header item.
Docs.value: A that represents a hot header item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Hot property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Hot property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementHeaderItem2` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#167](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.v_61_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#167](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.v_61_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a normal header item.
Docs.value: A that represents a normal header item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementHeaderItem1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#166](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.v_5_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#166](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.v_5_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a pressed header item.
Docs.value: A that represents a pressed header item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Pressed property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Pressed property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementHeaderItem3` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
